definition: Tudi Gong, the God of the earth
Tu (ethnic group)/surname Tu
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor asked the Earth God to inform all the animals about this news.
sentences.chinese: 玉皇大帝就通知土地公去公佈一個消息。

sentences.english: I do not mean to offend the Earth god, but I use its image as a metaphor to mock at the corrupting bureaucrat culture.
sentences.chinese: 來聽聽如何透過土地公傳達一些意象來調侃官僚文化。
